metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1999013 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: FFmpeg before commit a7e032a277452366771951e29fd0bf2bd5c029f0 contains ause-after-free vulnerability in the realmedia demuxer that can result invulnerability allows attacker to read heap memory. This attack appear to beexploitable via specially crafted RM file has to be provided as input. Thisvulnerability appears to have been fixed ina7e032a277452366771951e29fd0bf2bd5c029f0 and later.

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
gst-libav1.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
